guideContainer.name: guide1
guideContainer.thankYouMessage: Thank you for submitting conflict of interest questionnaire.

guidetextdraw._value:
A conflict of interest arises if your personal interest, such as an outside activity or relationship, affects or appears to affect your ability to act on behalf of Company. If you have a potential conflict, you must disclose your circumstances to the Compliance Office and take steps to protect both you and Company

Step 1 – Disclosure

The Conflict of Interest Policy requires regular employees, interns, and certain temporary employees to disclose in writing any information regarding themselves and certain related persons that may pose a conflict of interest with Company. Any changed circumstance or new potential conflict of interest must also be disclosed as soon as it develops.

Step 2 – Review and Conflict Control
The Compliance Office will review your disclosure, and when necessary, you and your manager may be required to take appropriate precautions to avoid a conflict of interest. You will only be contacted if there are follow-up questions or precautions that need to be pursued.
guidetextdraw.name: textdraw1479451964869

guidetextdraw._value:
"Direct customer" means any receiver of Company"s products, materials, services, or property.

"Direct supplier" means any entity that directly supplies or seeks to supply goods, materials, services, personnel, or property to Company. 
 
"Government department" and "state-owned entity" include:

  • Any sector of a national, state, or local government that deals with a particular area of interest; and
  • Any legal entity wholly or partially owned or controlled by a government.

"Potential competitor" means any entity that currently competes with Company, or may begin to compete with Company in the foreseeable future.

“Related party” includes:

  • Your spouse, domestic partner, child, brother, sister, parent, mother- or father-in-law, son- or daughter-in-law, or brother- or sister-in-law (each a “related person”).
  • Any corporation, company or other organization of which you or a related person are a board member, officer, partner, or owner of a significant investment.

“Significant investment” includes:

  • A direct or indirect beneficial ownership or financial interest that could (or could appear to) influence your judgment or ability to act on behalf of Company; and
  • Any investment greater than 5% of the securities or other beneficial interest in an outside company or business.

guidetextdraw_668034099._value:
Direct customer means any receiver of Company"s products, materials, services, or property.

Direct supplier means any entity that directly supplies or seeks to supply goods, materials, services, personnel, or property to Company.

Government department and state-owned entity include:

  • Any sector of a national, state, or local government that deals with a particular area of interest; and
  • Any legal entity wholly or partially owned or controlled by a government.

Potential competitor means any entity that currently competes with Company, or may begin to compete with Company in the foreseeable future.
Related party includes:

  • Your spouse, domestic partner, child, brother, sister, parent, mother- or father-in-law, son- or daughter-in-law, or brother- or sister-in-law (each a “related person”);
  • Any corporation, company or other organization of which you or a related person are a board member, officer, partner, or owner of a significant investment.
guidetextdraw_668034099.name: textdraw_6680340991479453699275

guidetextdraw._value:
I certify that my answers in this questionnaire are true and correct to the best of my knowledge.
 
I understand and agree to follow the Conflict of Interest Policy.  I understand that either a knowing failure to respond truthfully to this questionnaire or a violation of the  Conflict of Interest Policy may result in disciplinary action, up to and including termination of employment.
guidetextdraw.name: textdraw1479456004535
